DID YOU KNOW that #FVSD has a variety of Child Care Programs???
.
Extended School Program (ESP)
We offer before and after school childcare at all FVSD elementary schools. We also offer care during Thanksgiving Break, Winter Break, Spring Break and the Summer.
.
Child Development Center Preschools (CDC)
We have preschools at all elementary schools. We offer full day and part day programs and are also available in the summer.
.
State Preschools
State Preschool is offered at Oka School for 4 year olds, Gisler School for 3 year olds, and at Newland school for 2.9 year olds.
We accept families based on need from our school district boundaries first, if we do not fill up we will take out-of-district families.
.
All schools follow the school year calendar for the Fountain Valley School District.
.
For more information on these programs, please visit our website:
www.fvsdchildcareprograms.com

Newland is an amazing place. We have great teachers and high standards. All of which is very important but so is having fun. There is all kinds of research that has been done which indicates that students do best in school when they have good mental health and are satisfied with their lives. No matter how good schools and teachers are, students’ academic achievement suffers when they’re unhappy. That is why Newland has put a put a premium on student experience. Students who are happy and satisfied with their time in school are more engaged with their schoolwork, more resilient to academic setbacks, and ultimately more likely to get good grades.

For more great happenings at Newland, follow them year round on twitter @NewlandDolphins. #NewlandDolphins 🐬 #FVSDdriven 🚗 #weheartFVSD ❤

For two years now, Newland’s staff has been highly focused on reading. Teachers at Newland have been working on better understanding the ELA standards, using the Fountas & Pinnell Benchmark Assessment Systems, and training in Teachers Workshop models. They have also worked of fostering a strong love of reading. This year, Newland has held special events such as full school reading afternoons and a Reading Fiesta Night put on by teachers at Newland for our families. Newland staff had a night to celebrate reading with guest readers and speakers, fun activities, and even opportunities to read with therapy dogs. The night was wonderfully successful with over 500 people in attendance. It has been amazing to see Newland teachers share their love of reading with students and families alike.

For more great happenings at Newland, follow them year round on twitter @NewlandDolphins. #NewlandDolphins 🐬 #FVSDdriven 🚗 #weheartFVSD ❤ #reading 📚 NewNewland PTA

Offering students leadership opportunities provides students exposure to the knowledge and skills needed for future leaders in high school, the job force, and the global community. While there are several chances to get exposure to these skills on campus, Talbert has two programs specifically focused on leadership development. ASB (Associated Student Body) grooms leaders through school activities, formal lead meetings where students serve as the voice for the overall campus, and learning how to facilitate school events. PAL (Peer Assistance League) focuses on creating a positive campus culture through participation in activities such as Kindness Week and Red Ribbon Week, as well as through supporting community and charity needs. Through school involvement, these students grow immensely in confidence, developing school connectedness, and communication skills.
